name: International Confederation of European Beet Growers
membership:
- CIBE is a permanent expert observer at the European Farmers association (COPA/COGECA)
- CIBE holds a seat on the Executive Committee of the World Association of Sugar Beet and Cane Growers (WABCG)
goal:
Members of CIBE are national and regional associations. At present CIBE represents sugar beet growers from 18 European beet-producing countries; this includes 150,000 growers from 16 EU countries (Austria, Belgium, the Czech Republic, Denmark, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Hungary, Italy, the Netherlands, Poland, Romania, the Slovak Republic, Sweden, the United Kingdom) as well as 150,000 growers from 2 non-EU countries (Switzerland and Turkey).

CIBE represents and defends the interests of beetgrowers within the European Institutions and international organisations on fundamental issues such as:


- The EU Sugar Regulation
- The Common Agricultural Policy
- International and bilateral negotiations on free trade agreements
- Agronomic and technical beet issues
- Sugar, sugar by-products and bio-fuel market issues
- Environmental issues
interests: Agriculture, Budget, Climate Action, Competition, Customs, Enlargement, Environment, External Relations, Food Safety, International co-operation and development, Research and innovation, Single market, Trade
euInitiatives:
1) Common Agriculture Policy (CAP)
2) EU Renewable Energy Policy
3) EU Trade Policy
4) Food and Feed Safety
5) Environmental Policy
